intro: Alyxia latilimba, commonly known as the broad-leaved alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink to red, with five lobes and a prominent corona. Alyxia latilimba thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
